repnme.cdata!:
Latin America - Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project for Latin America were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory; risk to global environment
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was satisfactory and
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: project design is an effective framework
            for multi-country collaboration and capacity-building and
            proved to be an appropriate mechanism for achieving project
            objectives. However, it can be strengthened by the explicit
            inclusion of components on communications and project
            management and by the adequate allocation of resources for
            financial management and oversight. Continuous and active
            engagement of environmental and agricultural sector
            entities, as well as Global Environment Fund (GEF) focal
            points in each country is critical for project
            implementation and leverage of buy-in in the changing
            political economy of biosafety. The challenges experienced
            in the financial management of the project point towards the
            need to rethink implementation support for regional
            initiatives and the need for streamlining of financial
            management approaches.

repnme.cdata!:
Latin America - Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project for Latin America is to strengthen the
            capacity in the four participating countries to implement
            the Cartagena protocol on biosafety. Specifically, it aims
            to strengthen the technical capacity in knowledge generation
            for biosafety risk assessment and management; and strengthen
            the biosafety decision-making capacity. The need for
            extension has been discussed within the project teams
            comprising the regional coordinator, the four national
            coordinators and the thematic leaders. Consequently, project
            activities (through subprojects) that depend on an
            agricultural calendar and crop biological processes, such as
            planting and harvesting seasons, will need to continue
            beyond the current closing date.

            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol

repnme.cdata!:
Latin America - Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project for Latin America is to strengthen the
            capacity in the four participating countries to implement
            the Cartagena protocol on biosafety. Specifically, it aims
            to strengthen the technical capacity in knowledge generation
            for biosafety risk assessment and management; and strengthen
            the biosafety decision-making capacity. The closing date of
            the project will be extended from June 30, 2011 until June
            30, 2012. The need for extension has been discussed within
            the project teams comprising the regional coordinator, the
            four national coordinators and the thematic leaders. There
            is a consensus that a one year extension is required for the
            following reasons. Declaration of effectiveness was delayed
            by almost 6 months. This in turn caused a delay in the first
            disbursement for project activities (on June 20, 2009), as
            well as in the signing of the legal agreements between the
            regional and the national implementing institutions, and
            participating entities. Consequently, project activities
            (through subprojects) that depend on an agricultural
            calendar and crop biological processes, such as planting and
            harvesting seasons, will need to continue beyond the current
            closing date.

repnme.cdata!:
Latin America - Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project for Latin America is to strengthen the
            capacity in the four participating countries to implement
            the Cartagena protocol on biosafety. Specifically, it aims
            to strengthen the technical capacity in knowledge generation
            for biosafety risk assessment and management; and strengthen
            the biosafety decision-making capacity. The changes include:
            change of a national coordinating agency in one of the four
            project countries. In Colombia the national coordinating
            agency is to change from Instituto Alexander von Humboldt to Corpoica.
